wikitext.*:
{{Incomplete}} The '''Túrin Wrapper''' comprises three [[Sindarin]]Hostetter notes that while he adopts "Sindarin" for convenience, the exact dates of the texts are not known, and thus may be late [[Noldorin]], [[Beleriandic]], or early Sindarin texts pertaining to the [[Narn i Chîn Húrin (tale)|Narn i Chîn Húrin]] of the 1950s composed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. It was published, along with translations and analysis by [[Carl F. Hostetter]], in [[Vinyar Tengwar 50]]. ==Area IV== Area IV on the wrapper contains text detailing dialogue from [[Rían]] to her infant son [[Tuor]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Sindarin !! Translation |- | A Rían pent >> Arp >> Arphent Rían Tourna man agrorech?
Sí {?a?l il cem >>} il chem
{na >>} en i naugrim en ir Ellath
{natho >>} thor {a >>} den ammen || And said Rían to Tour 'What have we done?'
'Now all [?the earth/hands/hearts]'
'of the dwarves [and] of the Elves'
'will be [?opposed/?silent] to us' |} {{references|note}} == External links == * [https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1397828061.html?neo Túrin Wrapper on Eldamo] [[Category:Manuscripts by J.R.R. Tolkien]]
